notes_text: A non-binding referendum in August 2022 asked "Should we review our cannabis laws to allow for research and medicinal use?" 62% voted yes.
notes: A non-binding referendum in August 2022 asked "Should we review our cannabis laws to allow for research and medicinal use?" 62% voted yes.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in the Cook Islands}} A [[2022 Cook Islands medical cannabis referendum|non-binding referendum]] in August 2022 asked "Should we review our cannabis laws to allow for research and medicinal use?" 62% voted yes.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Kumar |first1=Rashneel |title=62 per cent vote yes for cannabis law reform |url=https://www.cookislandsnews.com/internal/national/breaking-news/62-per-cent-vote-yes-for-cannabis-law-reform/ |access-date=11 January 2023 |work=Cook Islands News |date=11 August 2022 |archive-date=11 January 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230111204302/https://www.cookislandsnews.com/internal/national/breaking-news/62-per-cent-vote-yes-for-cannabis-law-reform/ |url-status=live }}</ref>
